books.title: The Gods of Pegāna
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A mysterious god creates a cosmic pantheon to rule over its worlds and time.

books.title: The Vicomte de Bragelonne
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.summary: The events of the early days of Louis XIV’s majority reign in France, including the continuing story of the four musketeers who served both Louis XIV’s father and himself.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Cornelli
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A young girl’s emotional hurt requires time and love to heal.

books.title: She Stoops to Conquer
books.author: Oliver Goldsmith
books.summary: Two young men visit the countryside: one to find a wife, and the other to avoid one.

books.title: The Comedy of Errors
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two sets of identical twins are mistaken for their lost siblings.

books.title: Khaled
books.author: F. Marion Crawford
books.summary: A powerful genie is condemned to live the life of a man, unless he can find true love.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: A Personal Record
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: Conrad recounts his childhood in Poland, his sailing experiences, and the work on his debut novel.

books.title: The Shore Road Mystery
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Two amateur slueths endeavor to break up a carjacking ring.

books.title: Disenchantment
books.author: C. E. Montague
books.summary: A World War I veteran analyzes how the war affected the collective British psyche.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: Don Juan
books.author: Lord Byron
books.summary: A Spanish libertine becomes an unwitting seducer through a series of adventurous escapades.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: The Big Time
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A motley collection of servicemembers escape a plot as two mysterious factions wage an epic war across time itself.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Vladimir Korolenko
books.summary: A collection of Vladimir Korolenko’s translated short stories and novellas, ordered by date of translated publication.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
